applicability_reasoning: This regulation (347) specifically applies to health insurance contracts and notifications regarding lapse of health insurance coverage. The document in question is about an Executive Pension Life Cover Scheme, which is a type of occupational pension scheme providing death benefits for company employees. The document clearly states it is governed by the Pensions Act 1990 and is a retirement benefits scheme as defined by Chapter 1 of Part 30 of the TCA. Additionally, regulation 347(2) explicitly states that it does not apply to corporate insurance schemes arranged by employers for groups of employees, which this document represents. The document details a company pension life cover scheme that is established by an employer for the benefit of employees, making it fall outside the scope of this health insurance-focused regulation.
regulation_title: Notification of lapse of cover under health insurance contract
regulation_text: 347. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), this Regulation applies in relation to a health insurance contract entered into after the commencement of these Regulations (including a renewal in a case where the health insurance contract was concluded before such commencement) . (2) This Regulation does not apply in respect of a health insurance contract under a corporate health insurance scheme arranged by an employer with an insurance undertaking for a group of employees. (3) An insurance undertaking shall notify a consumer that is a natural person aged 18 years or older within 10 working days of the consumer ceasing to be insured under a health insurance contract with that insurance undertaking. (4) The notification referred to in paragraph (3) shall inform the consumer - (a) that the consumer is no longer insured under a health insurance contract with that insurance undertaking, and (b) the date on which the consumer ceased to be so insured. (5) Paragraphs (3) and (4) do not apply where - (a) the consumer ceased to be insured under the health insurance contract referred to in paragraph (1) on account of the expiry of that health insurance contract, (b) the health insurance contract is immediately replaced with another health insurance contract with the same insurance undertaking, and (c) the consumer is insured under that replacement health insurance contract. (6) For the purposes of providing notification pursuant to paragraphs (3) and (4), an insurance undertaking shall gather contact details of each consumer that is a natural person aged 18 years or older who is insured under a health insurance contract with that insurance undertaking. (7) Paragraphs (3) and (4) do not apply where the insurance undertaking has requested contact details in accordance with paragraph (6) but has not been provided with same before the 10 working day period referred to in paragraph (3) has commenced.
